history.text: Hi
Have you ever seen home alone I have not
Hello
Yes I have seen Home Alone. It is a great movie.
I’ve heard good things about it but looks like rotten tomato kind of gave it a little rating is 62% low on rotten tomato I don’t know
Rotten Tomatoes does not get it right all of the time. Even though the movie was made in 1990, it is still hoot and holiday staple.
Oh this is the one with McAuley Culkin.
Looks like there’s a lot of physical comedy think I remember something about there being a bunch of traps sliding down stairs in the house
Yes. Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern did great as the two would be burglars.
It was kind a like the Three Stooges in that it had a lot of physical comedy
Joe Pesci I enjoy most of the work he has done so he placed the bad guy
Yes laugh out loud, slapstick comedy.

It looks like their whole family plan to spend Christmas in Paris but somehow Kevin or McAuley Culkin wasn’t able to make it and 
didn’t notice till after the plane
Yes the wind knocked the power out and the family rushed out of the house leaving him behind.
Yeah I guess that would be super confusing you went through stressful situations so I can kind of see how that can happen if
Kevin as punished but no one blamed Buzz which was pretty unfair.
Did the family have like a bunch of kids
I yeah parenting is not for the faint of heart you got to hold both  accountable
Yes there were several siblings and cousins in the house preparing to go on the trip.

It looks  like his mother was the first one to notice ihe wasgone but not until the plane 
take off
Yes. Imagine realizing your young child is left at home and you being the one to issue out the punishment in the first place.
That would be super overwhelming. But it looks like she go through a whole lot to get back .
Kate relentlessly fought to squeeze in on flights that were not even close to her destination. That's a mother's love.
Gus and the band were super sweet to give her a ride.
Yeah I seem like it would be such a serious movie but they mix it with a lot of comedy somehow maybe that was the slapstick part of it or the oddball aventures
So it looks like him will be having the house and them trying to get back to him kind of had a parallel pattern in the movie or do they just focus more on the house and the robbery
Sorry him booby trapping the house
It's parallell. The mother is concerned the whole time and Kevin is disappointed to find his family still gone.
Kevin was very smart to devise all the booby traps. He was even smart enough to not call the cops to his house and they discover he was home alone, but to a neighbor's house.

It seems like A good Christmas movie that teaches 
the value of family probably
Kevin seems very interesting
Absolutely. The family reunites as well as Kevin's new friend Marley's Family. It's very touching until Buzz realizes Kevin is still the pesky little brother he has always been.
Well thank you for teaching me about the movie you have a wonderful day
you as well
Make sure you check out the part where the father Peter  finds the missing gold tooth in the house. Gives him a clue that something strange may have occurred.

uid1response.feedback: The conversation did not go as smooth as I hoped. I'm not sure but the other person may have exited too early.
